newsitem.title: JAPAN: NCB 5.4% bond due June 97 traded at 6.0% - traders.
newsitem.headline: NCB 5.4% bond due June 97 traded at 6.0% - traders.

text.p: Nippon Credit Bank Ltd's (NCB) 5.4 percent five-year bank debenture due June 1997 traded at 6.0 percent on Tuesday, unchanged from Monday, traders said.
Two hundred million yen worth of the instruments changed hands, a brokerage house trader said.
Volume of trade in NCB debentures has been rising recently, fuelled by news about the long-term credit bank's restructuring efforts, traders said.
"Market players seem more willing than before to buy NCB debentures with relatively short maturities," a trader for a trust bank's securities unit said.

Last Thursday, before news about NCB's restructuring plans reached the market, NCB debentures with less than a year until maturity, including a five-year debenture due September 1997 with a coupon rate of 4.8 percent, traded at 8.0 percent.
Market players still seem reluctant, however, to buy NCB debentures with relatively long maturities, the trader for a trust bank's securities unit said.
He added that NCB's five-year bank debenture due July 1999 with a coupon rate of 3.5 percent was traded at 7.0 percent on Tuesday.

"There are fewer sell orders for NCB debentures than before... But (domestic) financial institutions are still reluctant to buy the bonds. I think buyers have been limited to foreign financial institutions," he said.
NCB on Tuesday announced a major restructuring plan that will mean the loss of 600 jobs, the sale of prime real estate and a withdrawal from major overseas markets.
The bank said it believes the scheme will help it to regain the market's trust.
